------_=_NextPart_001_01C0ABE3.D5C50A40
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"

Create a junit.properties file containing
 
    maxmessage=-1
 
And put it in your "home directory."  If you don't know what directory that
is, you can find out with a quick Java program:
 
    System.out.println(System.getProperty("user.home"));
 
If that directory is not acceptable, you can run JUnit with the extra JVM
parameter
 
    -Duser.home=/my/new/dir
 
Kevin
 
 

-----Original Message-----
From: srueger@... [mailto:srueger@...]
Sent: Tuesday, March 13, 2001 9:31 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Assert Messages getting "chopped" off


I'm very new to both Java and JUnit so I apologize if this question is 
just too stupid for words but....

Why does JUnit chop off the end of the message when you have a really 
long string compare in an Assert? For example, we end up with:

1) testStringStuff "expected:<test> but was:<this is a really really 
really really really really really really really really really really 
really really really really ..."

Above may not be exact but illustrates the problem.

Is this a java thing? A JUnit thing? Can I change it? 

- Shelley
